page.title: 02TOURISM:Places of interest
page.content: The area surveyed contains a number of interesting places which attract tourists. There is in fact a Tourist Information Office in the Moot Hall in the centre of Brampton. The Moot Hall is itself interesting.The present building was erected in 1817 and is octagonal in shape, but there has been a Moot Hall on the site since 1648. Outside are stocks and also a bull ring to which a bull as tied in the days of 'Bull Baiting' was a popular entertainment. Another building of interest in the town centre is known as Prince Charlie's House. today it is a shoe shop but it was where Bonny Prince Charlie had temporary headquarters during the 1745 Rebellion.
